result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Timothy R. O'Neil

defendant.name: O'Neil, Timothy R.

records.addlTxt:
9:47 AM case called. Prosecuting Attorney Monica A Fallon in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Timothy R. O'Neil in court with Attorney Ryan J. Moertel. Agreement has been reached for a 6 month Deferred Acceptance of Guilty Plea Agreement. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 

Defendant pleads Guilty to Count 2: Disorderly Conduct. Court accepts the plea but withholds the finding of guilt.

Remaining charges are dismissed and read in.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for April 17, 2023 at 09:30 am.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing on April 17, 2023 at 09:30 am.

9:38 AM case called. Prosecuting Attorney Afton Brianna Lewis in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Timothy R. O'Neil not in court.  Attorney Ryan J. Moertel in court for Timothy R. O'Neil. Attorney Moertel states the Defendant has a meeting scheduled with the DAGP coordinator and requests a new return date.
Hearing scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Authorization for Attorney Ryan Moertel to Appear and Act

Judge Jon Theisen for Branch 2 intake. 
(Case called at 11:30 AM) Defendant Timothy O'Neil appears in person with Attorney Ryan Moertel. ADA Afton Lewis appears in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense waives reading of the complaint. 
Hearing: 09/08/2022 at 9:30 AM.
